title: GradientExplorer, multi-input and different input shapes causing ValueError
body:
Hello,

according to [this examle](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/notebooks/gradient_explainer/Multi-input%20Gradient%20Explainer%20MNIST%20Example.ipynb), the GradientExplorer in SHAP supports multi-input.

However, when using different shapes for the inputs, the following error occurs:

> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
> TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
> TypeError: only size-1 arrays can be converted to Python scalars
> 
> The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
> 
> ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
> <ipython-input-11-b75425eaafab> in <module>
>      21 # explain predictions of the model on four images
>      22 explainer = shap.GradientExplainer(model, [background, rates])
> ---> 23 shap_values = explainer.shap_values([test_x_images[:5], test_x_rate[:5]])
>      24 
>      25 # plot the feature attributions
> 
> c:\anaconda3\envs\project\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\gradient.py in shap_values(self, X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
>     104         were chosen as "top".
>     105         """
> --> 106         return self.explainer.shap_values(X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
>     107 
>     108 
> 
> c:\anaconda3\envs\project\lib\site-packages\shap\explainers\gradient.py in shap_values(self, X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
>     265                 for l in range(len(X)):
>     266                     samples = grad[l] * samples_delta[l]
> --> 267                     phis[l][j] = samples.mean(0)
>     268                     phi_vars[l][j] = samples.var(0) / np.sqrt(samples.shape[0]) # estimate variance of means
>     269 
> 
> ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence.

The tensorflow version is 2.2.0. The following model is used:

```
model_input1 = layers.Input(shape=(None, None, 3))

x = layers.Conv2D(16,
                  kernel_size=(3, 3),
                  kernel_regularizer=l2(),
                  kernel_initializer='he_uniform',
                  use_bias=False,
                  name='conv1')(model_input1)
x = layers.BatchNormalization(name='conv1_bn')(x)
x = layers.Activation('relu', name='conv1_act')(x)
x = layers.MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2), strides=(2, 2))(x)

x = layers.Conv2D(32,
                  kernel_size=(3, 3),
                  kernel_regularizer=l2(),
                  kernel_initializer='he_uniform',
                  use_bias=False,
                  name='conv2')(x)
x = layers.BatchNormalization(name='conv2_bn')(x)
x = layers.Activation('relu', name='conv2_act')(x)
x = layers.MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2), strides=(2, 2))(x)

x = layers.Conv2D(32,
                  kernel_size=(3, 3),
                  kernel_regularizer=l2(),
                  kernel_initializer='he_uniform',
                  use_bias=False,
                  name='conv3')(x)
x = layers.BatchNormalization(name='conv3_bn')(x)
x = layers.Activation('relu', name='conv3_act')(x)
x = layers.MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2), strides=(2, 2))(x)

x = layers.GlobalAveragePooling2D()(x)

model_input2 = layers.Input(shape=(1,))
x = layers.concatenate([x, model_input2])

# Dense layer 1
x = layers.Dense(32,
                 activation=None,
                 kernel_regularizer=l2(),
                 kernel_initializer='he_uniform',
                 use_bias=False,
                 name='fc1')(x)
x = layers.BatchNormalization(name='fc1_bn')(x)
x = layers.Activation('relu', name='fc1_act')(x)

# Output layer
output = layers.Dense(2, activation='softmax', name='predictions')(x)
model = Model(inputs=[model_input1, model_input2], outputs=output, name='model')

# Usa RMSprop optimizer
optimizer = RMSprop(lr=1e-5)

# Compile model
model.compile(optimizer=optimizer, loss='categorical_crossentropy', metrics=['accuracy'])
```

Any ideas on what is causing this issue?

Thank you very much!
